channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for TN
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for TN

item.title: Report E-2023090051
item.description:
Report E-2023090051

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-07T15:11:51+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-22
  • City: KNOXVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On August 22, 2023, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN3260 was damaged by a load shift and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. FCE personnel utilized hand tools and a HEPA shop vacuum to collect the free standing product from the trailer floor The crew then utilized degreasing agent with absorbent wipes to collect any residual product. All UN3260-impacted material was collected and containerized in one 91) 55-gallon drum for disposal by R+L.

item.title: Report X-2023080939
item.description:
Report X-2023080939

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-07T15:11:51+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-07
  • City: NASHVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Wet fully regulated fiberboard box found on HMPA pallet within tote. Events prior unknown. DescribePack: One of one 2.5 gallon plastic jerrican lost 1.3 gallons from pinhole puncture to bottom of body (not on seam) from sharp protruding object during transit. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PPE was donned and ventilation was utilized.

item.title: Report X-2023080799
item.description:
Report X-2023080799

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-07T15:11:51+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-06
  • City: MURFREESBORO
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was discovered leaking at the unload side. The package was put in hazardous bag and into a red tote. The red tote was delivered to QA cage for further inspection. DescribePack: 2 of 4 1-gallon bottles had a loose causing leakage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: When the package was found leaking, it was placed in a hazardous bag and into a red tote.

item.title: Report X-2023080793
item.description:
Report X-2023080793

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-07T15:11:51+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-07
  • City: NASHVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Fiberboard box found leaking in tote on HMPA pallet. Events prior unknown. Overpack label was noticed on outer box but when inner content was inspected, no UNPOP markings were found. DescribePack: One of four 1 gallon plastic bottles lost 0.2 gallon due a loose cap closure. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The hazmat was placed in a lined and lidded tote. PPE and ventilation was utilized.

item.title: Report X-2023080721
item.description:
Report X-2023080721

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-06T15:11:55+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-04
  • City: MURFREESBORO
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Hazmat package was unloaded at door 21 at about 4:00AM on 08/04/2023. Upon being unloaded from the trailer, the package was covered with a black/purple stain. Absorbent pads were immediately used to contain the spill and a black tote was brought over from Quality Assurance upon notification. DescribePack: A 4.0 Liter bottle of Sysmex ColorWright Stain (UN1230) leaked out due to a loose cap on the plastic bottle. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: To control the spill, absorbent pads were used immediately and Quality Assurance was called to assess the spill, in which a black tote was used to prevent any more leakage on the dock.

item.title: Report E-2023080785
item.description:
Report E-2023080785

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-05T15:12:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-24
  • City: Jackson
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO CNW, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: While in transit, due to improper loading, a load shift occurred resulting in the release of 30 gallons of Spartan Shineline Emulsifier Plus, UN1760, from (6) 5-Gallon pails. The wooden trailer floor was impacted with product as well as asphalt outside of the trailer. HAZMAT contractors were dispatched for the containment and cleanup. A neutralizing agent was used during the remediation process.
